summary: The 2017 disaster season was unlike anything the U.S. had experienced: 15% of the population was affected by 3 back-to-back hurricanes and catastrophic wildfires. The law requires, where practical, that federal agencies give preference to local businesses in disaster areas for the contracts used to clean up and rebuild. The idea is to jumpstart the local economy. Among other things, we reviewed contracts 4 agencies...
title: 2017 Disaster Contracting: Actions Needed to Improve the Use of Post-Disaster Contracts to Support Response and Recovery
